DataElement.preferredName: Fixed Tissue Paraffin Blocks Availability Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text indicator to signify whether formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded tissue is available.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Agents employed in the preparation of histologic or pathologic specimens for the purpose of maintaining the existing form and structure of all of the constituent elements.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Concepts.definition: A compound that preserves tissues and cells for microscopic study.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Paraffin is a common name for a group of high molecular weight alkane hydrocarbons with the general formula CnH2n+2, where n is between 22 and 27. Paraffin is also a technical name for an alkane in general, but in most cases it refers specifically to a linear, or normal alkane. It is mostly found as a white, odorless, tasteless, waxy solid, with a melting point between 47C and 65C. It is insoluble in water, but soluble in ether, benzene, and certain esters. Paraffin is unaffected by most common chemical reagents but oxidizes readily. (from Wikipedia):Blocks; refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.

Concepts.definition: A common name for a group of high molecular weight alkane hydrocarbons with the general formula CnH2n+2, where n is between 22 and 27. Paraffin is also a technical name for an alkane in general, but in most cases it refers specifically to a linear, or normal alkane. It is mostly found as a white, odorless, tasteless, waxy solid, with a melting point between 47C and 65C. It is insoluble in water, but soluble in ether, benzene, and certain esters. Paraffin is unaffected by most common chemical reagents but oxidizes readily.
Refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.  These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is there formalin-fixed paraf
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded tissue available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a block or 25 unstained sections of formalin-fixed and paraffin-embedded primary tumor available to satisfy the primary tumor requirement specified in Section 7.2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Specimen is Formalin-fixed and Paraffin Embedded
ReferenceDocuments.description: Specimen is Formalin-fixed and Paraffin Embedded

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) primary, metastatic, or recurrent tumor tissue for molecular analysis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded tumor tissue for CLIA-certified KRAS mutation testing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will five unstained formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tumor tissue slides be submitted for determination of BAF250a immunohistochemistry (IHC) status?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tumor tissue for Rb1 testing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient with HGG have sufficient tumor material for planned biology studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient with HGG enrolled on Stratum B have sufficient tumor material for planned biology studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have sufficient tumor material as specified in the protocol for the planned biology studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Test5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tumor tissue for Rb1 testing if not previously tested in a CLIA certified laboratory?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded tumor tissue from the biopsy or curettage available for submission?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have sufficient tumor material for planned biology studies (optional for DIPG patient)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is tumour tissue available and able to be released for this patient, so that the specific and protocol-mandated correlative marker assays may be conducted?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have sufficient tumor tissue for MET activation confirmation using FDA approved panel if a MET aberration is identified using local test in a CLIA certified laboratory?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have sufficient pre-trial tumor tissue available for subgrouping?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tumor tissue for B7H3 (CD276) testing if not previously tested in a CLIA certified laboratory?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If MET aberration has been identified using local test in a CLIA certified lab, does the patient have sufficient tumor tissue for MET activation confirmation using an FDA approved panel?
